city.name: Barcelona

mustTries.name: Tapas
mustTries.description:
Tapa is dried or cured beef, mutton, venison or horse meat, although other meat or even fish may be used. Filipinos prepare tapa by using thin slices of meat and curing these with salt and spices as a preservation method.
Tapa is often cooked fried or grilled.

mustTries.name: Xuixo
mustTries.description: Xuixo is a viennoiserie pastry from the city of Girona in Catalonia, Spain. It's a deep-fried, sugar-coated cylindrical pastry filled with crema catalana.

mustTries.name: Croquette
mustTries.description: A croquette is a small breadcrumbed fried food roll containing, usually as main ingredients, ground meat, shellfish, fish, ham, cheese, mashed potatoes or vegetables, and mixed with béchamel or brown sauce, and soaked white bread, egg, onion, spices and herbs, wine, milk, beer, or some combination, sometimes with a filling, such as sautéed onions, mushrooms, or boiled eggs.

mustTries.name: Sobrassada
mustTries.description: Sobrassada is a raw, cured sausage from the Balearic Islands made with ground pork, paprika and salt and other spices.

mustTries.name: Fideuà
mustTries.description: Fideuà is a seafood dish originally from the coast of Valencia that is similar to paella, and even more so to arròs a banda, but with noodles instead of rice. Its main ingredients are pasta noodles, fish, and shellfish. It is seasoned mainly with lemon.

mustTries.name: Manchego
mustTries.description:
Manchego is a cheese made in the La Mancha region of Spain from the milk of sheep of the Manchega breed. It is aged between 60 days and 2 years.
Manchego has a firm and compact consistency and a buttery texture, and often contains small, unevenly distributed air pockets.

mustTries.name: Hot chocolate
mustTries.description: Hot chocolate, also known as drinking chocolate, cocoa, and as chocolate tea in Nigeria, is a heated drink consisting of shaved chocolate, melted chocolate or cocoa powder, heated milk or water, and usually a sweetener. Hot chocolate may be topped with whipped cream or marshmallows.

mustTries.name: Gazpacho
mustTries.description: Gazpacho or Andalusian gazpacho is a cold soup made of raw, blended vegetables. A classic of Spanish cuisine, it originated in the southern region of Andalusia. Gazpacho is widely eaten in Spain and Portugal, particularly during hot summers, as it is refreshing and cool.

mustTries.name: Churros
mustTries.description: A churro is a fried-dough pastry—predominantly choux—based snack. Churros are traditional in Spain and Portugal, from where they originate, as well as the Philippines and Ibero-America.

mustTries.name: Paella
mustTries.description: Paella is a Valencian rice dish that has ancient roots, but its modern form traces origins in the mid-19th century in the area around the Albufera lagoon on the east coast of Spain adjacent to the city of Valencia.

mustTries.name: Spanish omelette
mustTries.description: Spanish omelette or Spanish tortilla is the English name for a traditional dish from Spanish cuisine called tortilla española, tortilla de patatas or tortilla de papas.

city.description: Barcelona is a city on the coast of northeastern Spain. It is the capital and largest city of the autonomous community of Catalonia, as well as the second-most populous municipality of Spain. With a population of 1.6 million within city limits, its urban area extends to numerous neighboring municipalities within the Province of Barcelona and is home to around 4.8 million people, making it the fifth most populous urban area in the European Union after Paris, the Ruhr area, Madrid, and Milan. It is one of the largest metropolises on the Mediterranean Sea, located on the coast between the mouths of the rivers Llobregat and Besòs, and bounded to the west by the Serra de Collserola mountain range, the tallest peak of which is 512 meters (1,680 feet) high.

poi.name: Picasso Museum Barcelona Guided Tour
poi.description:
On this guided tour of the Picasso Museum in Barcelona, we'll explore the world's largest collection of works by one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

Picasso Museum Barcelona Guided Tour

At the scheduled time, we'll meet outside the Palau Dalmases to commence this guided tour of the Picasso Museum in Barcelona.

Following introductions, we'll tour the interior of this historic building in downtown Barcelona. Picasso spent his formative years in this Catalan city. This exhibition space has a permanent collection of over 4,000 of Picasso's pieces.

While exploring the museum, we will reveal the features that make the art pieces by this painter from Malaga unique. We'll admire the artist's work from his early stages, including masterpieces such as Science and Charity, Royan, and Las Meninas, a reinterpretation of Velázquez's famous painting.

Before concluding the tour, we will discuss other contemporary artists of Pablo Picasso and his influence in the art world over the years.

After an hour-and-a-half tour, we'll say goodbye so that you can continue to enjoy the museum at your own pace.

poi.name: Casa Batlló
poi.description: Casa Batlló is a building in the center of Barcelona. It was designed by Antoni Gaudí, and is considered one of his masterpieces. A remodel of a previously built house, it was redesigned in 1904 by Gaudí and has been refurbished several times after that.
poi.address: Pg. de Gràcia, 43, L'Eixample, 08007 Barcelona, Spain

poi.name: La Pedrera - Casa Milà
poi.description: Casa Milà, popularly known as La Pedrera or The stone quarry, a reference to its unconventional rough-hewn appearance, is a modernist building in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain. It was the last private residence designed by architect Antoni Gaudí and was built between 1906 and 1912.
poi.address: Pg. de Gràcia, 92, L'Eixample, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
